snippet: Nokia had the chance to put on a bold performance with its demonstration of new smartphones. Instead, a misleading promotional video has left the company looking a little desperate.
abstract: Nokia had the chance to put on a bold performance with its demonstration of new smartphones. Instead, a misleading promotional video has left the company looking a little desperate.

headline.main: Nokia's Misleading Video Dents Lumia's Image

snippet: Weak demand in growing markets like China affects the demand for computer chips.
abstract: Intel, the primary maker of computer chips, warns investors that revenue and profit margins would be lower than expected, citing the stalled personal computer market; lowers projected third-quarter revenue to about $13.2 billion, from the previous figure of about $13.8 billion.

headline.main: As PC Sales Turn Down, Intel Trims Its Outlook
headline.print_headline: As PC Sales Turn Down, Intel Trims Its Outlook

snippet: A start-up that uses social media to develop product has raised $68 million in a venture capital fund-raising round.
abstract: A start-up that uses social media to develop product has raised $68 million in a venture capital fund-raising round.

headline.main: Quirky Gets Backing From Andreessen Horowitz and Kleiner Perkins

snippet: Many international designers, including Victoria Beckham, find New York is the best location to show their creations.
The foundation that oversees Firefox says it will have a smartphone operating system on the market in early 2013. The phone is expected to cost one-sixth that of an iPhone.
abstract: The foundation that oversees Firefox says it will have a smartphone operating system on the market in early 2013. The phone is expected to cost one-sixth that of an iPhone.

headline.main: A Firefox Smartphone for the Developing World
headline.print_headline: Technology News: Mozilla Plans a Smartphone Operating System

snippet: A disappointing August employment report turned the market’s attention to what tools the Fed still had left to help the economy.
abstract: Stocks in the United States hold steady at a four-year high, closing out their best week since June as a disappointing jobs report fuels expectations that the Federal Reserve will soon act to stimulate the economy.

headline.main: Shares Hang On to Thursday’s Highs as Focus Veers to Fed
headline.print_headline: Shares Hang On to Thursday’s Highs as Focus Veers to Fed

snippet: How to add missing titles to iTunes tracks, long-term care looms as a rising Medicaid expense, why can't school be more like summer and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.
abstract: How to add missing titles to iTunes tracks, long-term care looms as a rising Medicaid expense, why can't school be more like summer and other consumer-focused news from The New York Times.

headline.main: Friday Reading: How to Add Missing Titles to iTunes Tracks

snippet: Also, as the political conventions draw to a close, Mitt Romney announces a new series of 15 advertisements to run in battleground states; and Dan Balz has written 1,500 front-page articles for The Washington Post.
abstract: Also, as the political conventions draw to a close, Mitt Romney announces a new series of 15 advertisements to run in battleground states; and Dan Balz has written 1,500 front-page articles for The Washington Post.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: New Amazon Devices, and Apple's Plans for Digital Radio

snippet: Apple plans to develop a service that would compete with Pandora Media and similar services by sending streams of music customized to users' tastes, report Ben Sisario and Nick Wingfield on Friday in The New York Times.
abstract: Apple plans to develop a service that would compete with Pandora Media and similar services by sending streams of music customized to users' tastes, report Ben Sisario and Nick Wingfield on Friday in The New York Times.

headline.main: Daily Report: Apple Plans a Move Into Streaming Music
